learning_outcomes.description: Describe patient’s rights to health care and explain complaint mechanisms at practitioner and governance level.
Explain principles of responsible communication and professional use of media.
Reflect on the importance of practising with personal and professional integrity, honesty, and trustworthiness.
Analyse and make judgements on scenarios which involve patients' consent, confidentiality, and autonomy.
Apply the policies of the regulatory bodies that govern the provision of oral health services in Australia.
Critically apply the ethical principles and legal responsibilities underpinning the provision of dental care.

assessments.task_description: Students will be presented with a choice of five ethical scenarios. Each student is required to individually produce a reflective response that thoughtfully engages with the scenario selected. The reflection must integrate relevant ethical concepts, theories, and frameworks discussed in class. The submission format should be a video. Students may optionally use a PowerPoint presentation to accompany their reflection.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: In this task, you are required to choose a contemporary issue and author a policy brief of 2,000 words on a contentious issue relating to either: National health law, AHPRA policies, guidelines or codes, complaint mechanisms governance level, or principles of professional use of media. You should aim your policy brief at policymakers within the Australian Government Department of Health or Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
A 1-hour exam consisting of different question types including but not limited to multiple choice, short answer questions, short essays and problem-solving covering content from Week 1 to Week 13 (inclusive).

This is a MUST PASS assessment item (achieve a minimum of 50% to pass). Supplementary assessment is available for this item (in accordance with PPL Assessment Procedure Section 3 Part J).
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
